abstracts.cdata!:
The closing date for Kazakhstan
            Agricultural Competitiveness Project will be extended from
            July 30, 2010 until June 30, 2012. The extension is
            necessary to complete financing of the grants which were
            already approved and still disbursing from loan funds and to
            complete design of a new building for laboratory in part A.2
            of the project description. In first three rounds, 356
            subprojects have been approved and started implementation;
            while in the fourth round an additional 221 sub-projects
            have been approved and will start disbursing after extension
            of the closing date. In addition, the contract for designing
            the National Reference Laboratory is in the final phase of
            negotiation. Although the request is to extend the project
            until June 30, 2013 the team feels that at the moment
            extending until June 30, 2012 is fully sufficient to
            complete design/construction of the laboratory, conduct a
            tender to select contractor for construction of the
            laboratory and financing of the grant subprojects. The
            Ministry of Agriculture remains committed to complete
            construction in spite of the delays and procurement
            difficulties, and have expressed interest in initiating a
            dialogue with the Bank on a possible follow-up operation.
            This will be the first extension of the project.
